column2: Forgive your enemies, but never forget their names.\n-John F. Kennedy

When I was in the White House, I was confronted with the challenge of the Cold War. Both the Soviet Union and I had 30,000 nuclear weapons that could destroy the entire earth and I had to maintain the peace.\n-Jimmy Carter
The Cold War isn't thawing, it is burning with a deadly heat. Communism isn't sleeping, it is, as always, plotting, scheming, working, fighting.\n-Richard M. Nixon
The art of politics consists in knowing precisely when it is necessary to hit an opponent slightly below the belt.\n-Konrad Adenauer
Only the stupidest calves choose their own butcher.\n-Konrad Adenauer
Kennedy cooked the soup that Johnson had to eat.\n-Konrad Adenauer
History is the sum total of things that could have been avoided.\n-Konrad Adenauer
My advisers built a wall between myself and my people. I didn't realize what was happening. When I woke up, I had lost my people.\n-Mohammed Reza Pahlavi
Let me tell you quite bluntly that this king business has given me personally nothing but headaches.\n-Mohammed Reza Pahlavi
One thing I congratulate everyone on is the great explosion which has occurred in Washington's Black House and the very important scandal which has gripped leaders of America.\n-Ayatollah Khomeini
I once said, 'We will bury you,' and I got into trouble for it. Of course we will not bury you with a shovel. Your own working class will bury you.\n-Nikita Khrushchev
Support by United States rulers is rather in the nature of the support that the rope gives to a hanged man.\n-Nikita Khrushchev
If you start throwing hedgehogs under me, I shall throw a couple of porcupines under you.\n-Nikita Khrushchev
If you cannot catch a bird of paradise, better take a wet hen.\n-Nikita Khrushchev
Economics is a subject that does not greatly respect one's wishes.\n-Nikita Khrushchev
Call it what you will, incentives are what get people to work harder.\n-Nikita Khrushchev
Change is the law of life. And those who look only to the past or present are certain to miss the future.\n-John F. Kennedy

Let us not seek the Republican answer or the Democratic answer, but the right answer. Let us not seek to fix the blame for the past. Let us accept our own responsibility for the future.\n-John F. Kennedy
I don't know why you use a fancy French word like detente when there's a good English phrase for it - Cold War.\n-Golda Meir
Those who make peaceful revolution impossible will make violent revolution inevitable.\n-John F. Kennedy

Let every nation know, whether it wishes us well or ill, that we shall pay any price, bear any burden, meet any hardship, support any friend, oppose any foe to assure the survival and the success of liberty.\n-John F. Kennedy
The best road to progress is freedom's road.\n-John F. Kennedy
If a free society cannot help the many who are poor, it cannot save the few who are rich.\n-John F. Kennedy
When written in Chinese, the word 'crisis' is composed of two characters. One represents danger and the other represents opportunity.\n-John F. Kennedy
Mankind must put an end to war before war puts an end to mankind.\n-John F. Kennedy
Peace is a daily, a weekly, a monthly process, gradually changing opinions, slowly eroding old barriers, quietly building new structures.\n-John F. Kennedy
Let us never negotiate out of fear. But let us never fear to negotiate.\n-John F. Kennedy
Communism is not love. Communism is a hammer which we use to crush the enemy.\n-Mao Zedong
War can only be abolished through war, and in order to get rid of the gun it is necessary to take up the gun.\n-Mao Zedong
In time of difficulties, we must not lose sight of our achievements.\n-Mao Zedong
The guerrilla must move amongst the people as a fish swims in the sea.\n-Mao Zedong
Political work is the life-blood of all economic work.\n-Mao Zedong
I have always been and will be an enemy of communism, but I love all people.\n-Lech Walesa
Our firm conviction that ours is a just cause and that we must find a peaceful way to attain our goals gave us the strength and the awareness of the limits beyond which we must not go.\n-Lech Walesa
Freedom must be gained step by step, slowly. Freedom is a food which must be carefully administered when people are too hungry for it.\n-Lech Walesa
People always ask me, 'Lech, aren't you afraid of being killed?' And as an answer I shrug my shoulders.\n-Lech Walesa
I began revolution with 82 men. If I had to do it again, I do it with 10 or 15 and absolute faith. It does not matter how small you are if you have faith and plan of action.\n-Fidel Castro
I find capitalism repugnant. It is filthy, it is gross, it is alienating... because it causes war, hypocrisy and competition.\n-Fidel Castro
They talk about the failure of socialism but where is the success of capitalism in Africa, Asia and Latin America?\n-Fidel Castro
A revolution is a struggle to the death between the future and the past.\n-Fidel Castro
The revolution is a dictatorship of the exploited against the exploiters.\n-Fidel Castro
There is not Communism or Marxism, but representative democracy and social justice in a well-planned economy.\n-Fidel Castro
Peace is a journey of a thousand miles and it must be taken one step at a time.\n-Lyndon B. Johnson
The guns and the bombs, the rockets and the warships, are all symbols of human failure.\n-Lyndon B. Johnson
There are no problems we cannot solve together, and very few that we can solve by ourselves.\n-Lyndon B. Johnson

You do not examine legislation in the light of the benefits it will convey if properly administered, but in the light of the wrongs it would do and the harms it would cause if improperly administered.\n-Lyndon B. Johnson
We are not about to send American boys 9 or 10 thousand miles away from home to do what Asian boys ought to be doing for themselves.\n-Lyndon B. Johnson
While you're saving your face, you're losing your ass.\n-Lyndon B. Johnson
Doing what's right isn't the problem. It is knowing what's right.\n-Lyndon B. Johnson

Until justice is blind to color, until education is unaware of race, until opportunity is unconcerned with the color of men's skins, emancipation will be a proclamation but not a fact.\n-Lyndon B. Johnson
A man without a vote is man without protection.\n-Lyndon B. Johnson
There are no favorites in my office. I treat them all with the same general inconsideration.\n-Lyndon B. Johnson
I once told Nixon that the Presidency is like being a jackass caught in a hail storm. You've got to just stand there and take it.\n-Lyndon B. Johnson
We have talked long enough in this country about equal rights. It is time now to write the next chapter - and to write it in the books of law.\n-Lyndon B. Johnson
One sits the whole day at the desk and appetite is standing next to me. 'Away with you,' I say. But Comrade Appetite does not budge from the spot.\n-Leonid I. Brezhnev
We should not pour muck on ourselves.\n-Leonid I. Brezhnev
Whatever else may divide us, Europe is our common home: a common fate has linked us through the centuries, and it continues to link us today.\n-Leonid I. Brezhnev
I see Earth! It is so beautiful!\n-Yuri Gagarin
I could have gone on flying through space forever.\n-Yuri Gagarin

It suddenly struck me that that tiny pea, pretty and blue, was the Earth. I put up my thumb and shut one eye, and my thumb blotted out the planet Earth. I didn't feel like a giant. I felt very, very small.\n-Neil Armstrong
Houston, Tranquillity Base here. The Eagle has landed.\n-Neil Armstrong
Science has not yet mastered prophecy. We predict too much for the next year and yet far too little for the next 10.\n-Neil Armstrong
Here men from the planet Earth first set foot upon the Moon. July 1969 AD. We came in peace for all mankind.\n-Neil Armstrong
Since he is of no use anymore, there is no gain if he lives and no loss if he dies.\n-Pol Pot
I want you to know that everything I did, I did for my country.\n-Pol Pot
Yes, Samantha, we in the Soviet Union are trying to do everything so that there will not be war on Earth. This is what every Soviet man wants.\n-Yuri Andropov
Neither an ox nor a donkey is able to stop the progress of socialism.\n-Erich Honecker
The Wall will be standing in 50 and even in 100 years, if the reasons for it are not removed.\n-Erich Honecker
This hunger for profits causes great misery for the people.\n-Walter Ulbricht
The government of the German Democratic Republic rejects secret policies. It works for the people, and only the people, so it does not need to keep secrets like the warmongers.\n-Walter Ulbricht
The nature of a democracy consists to an important degree in the right of the people to criticize problems and mistakes.\n-Walter Ulbricht
The success of each of us benefits us all, and the success of us all benefits each of us individually.\n-Walter Ulbricht
Forgiveness is the answer to the child's dream of a miracle by which what is broken is made whole again, what is soiled is made clean again.\n-Dag Hammarskjold
It is playing safe that we create a world of utmost insecurity.\n-Dag Hammarskjold
Never look down to test the ground before taking your next step
column3: only he who keeps his eye fixed on the far horizon will find the right road.\n-Dag Hammarskjold

column2: Never measure the height of a mountain until you have reached the top. Then you will see how low it was.\n-Dag Hammarskjold
Freedom from fear - could be said to sum up the whole philosophy of human rights.\n-Dag Hammarskjold
A task becomes a duty from the moment you suspect it to be an essential part of that integrity which alone entitles a man to assume responsibility.\n-Dag Hammarskjold
Do not seek death. Death will find you. But seek the road which makes death a fulfillment.\n-Dag Hammarskjold
Freedom from fear' could be said to sum up the whole philosophy of human rights.\n-Dag Hammarskjold
Never, for the sake of peace and quiet, deny your own experience or convictions.\n-Dag Hammaskjold
Remember, the storm is a good opportunity for the pine and the cypress to show their strength and their stability.\n-Ho Chi Minh
Nothing is more precious than independence and liberty.\n-Ho Chi Minh
People tend to forget their duties but remember their rights.\n-Indira Gandhi
You cannot shake hands with a clenched fist.\n-Indira Gandhi
Forgiveness is a virtue of the brave.\n-Indira Gandhi
My father was a statesman, I am a political woman. My father was a saint. I am not.\n-Indira Gandhi
Martyrdom does not end something, it only a beginning.\n-Indira Gandhi
A nation' s strength ultimately consists in what it can do on its own, and not in what it can borrow from others.\n-Indira Gandhi
It's not for me. I tried human flesh and it's too salty for my taste.\n-Idi Amin
Sometimes people mistake the way I talk for what I am thinking.\n-Idi Amin
You cannot run faster than a bullet.\n-Idi Amin
In any country there must be people who have to die. They are the sacrifices any nation has to make to achieve law and order.\n-Idi Amin
If we knew the meaning to everything that is happening to us, then there would be no meaning.\n-Idi Amin
Follow me if I advance! Kill me if I retreat! Revenge me if I die!\n-Ngo Dinh Diem
For some days, people thought that India was shaking. But there are always tremors when a great tree falls.\n-Rajiv Gandhi
Jesus was the first socialist, the first to seek a better life for mankind.\n-Mikhail Gorbachev
I am a Communist, a convinced Communist! For some that may be a fantasy. But to me it is my main goal.\n-Mikhail Gorbachev
It would be naive to think that the problems plaguing mankind today can be solved with means and methods which were applied or seemed to work in the past.\n-Mikhail Gorbachev
What we need is Star Peace and not Star Wars.\n-Mikhail Gorbachev
More socialism means more democracy, openness and collectivism in everyday life.\n-Mikhail Gorbachev
If what you have done yesterday still looks big to you, you haven't done much today.\n-Mikhail Gorbachev
The task of the leader is to get his people from where they are to where they have not been.\n-Henry A. Kissinger
Power is the great aphrodisiac.\n-Henry A. Kissinger
Ninety percent of the politicians give the other ten percent a bad reputation.\n-Henry A. Kissinger
The illegal we do immediately. The unconstitutional takes a little longer.\n-Henry A. Kissinger
No country can act wisely simultaneously in every part of the globe at every moment of time.\n-Henry A. Kissinger
Diplomacy, the art of restraining power.\n-Henry A. Kissinger
If you want to make peace with your enemy, you have to work with your enemy. Then he becomes your partner.\n-Nelson Mandela
It always seems impossible until its done.\n-Nelson Mandela
We know how to organize warfare, but do we know how to act when confronted with peace?\n-Jacques-Yves Cousteau

I like to believe that people in the long run are going to do more to promote peace than our governments. Indeed, I think that people want peace so much that one of these days governments had better get out of the way and let them have it.\n-Dwight D. Eisenhower

You have broader considerations that might follow what you would call the falling domino principle. You have a row of dominoes set up. You knock over the first one, and what will happen to the last one is the certainty that it will go over very quickly.\n-Dwight D. Eisenhower
This world in arms is not spending money alone. It is spending the sweat of its laborers, the genius of its scientists, the hopes of its children.\n-Dwight D. Eisenhower

Unless man can match his strides in weaponry and technology with equal strides in social and political development, our great strength, like that of the dinosaur, will become incapable of proper control and like the dinosaur vanish from the earth.\n-John F. Kennedy
The sad truth is that most evil is done by people who never make up their minds to be good or evil.\n-Hannah Arendt

Power and violence are opposites: where the one rules absolutely, the other is absent. Violence appears where power is in jeopardy, but left to its own course it ends in power's disappearance.\n-Hannah Arendt
We already had success in creating a democratic, national government that is revolutionary and popular. That is how socialism begins, not with decrees.\n-Salvador Allende
I don't see why we need to stand by and watch a country go communist due to the irresponsibility of its own people.\n-Henry A. Kissinger

The only use for an atomic bomb is to keep somebody else from using one. It can give us no protection--only the doubtful satisfaction of retaliation. Nuclear weapons offer us nothing but a balance of terror, and a balance of terror is still terror.\n-George Wald
America is an elephant. Cyprus is a flea. Greece is a flea. If these two fleas continue itching the elephant they may get whacked by the elephant's trunk, whacked good.\n-Lyndon B. Johnson

We have to get tough with the Russians. They don't know how to behave. They are like bulls in a china shop. They are only 25 years old. We are over 100 and the British are centuries older.  We have got to teach them how to behave.\n-Harry S. Truman
From Stettin in the Baltic to Trieste in the Adriatic, an iron curtain has descended across the continent.\n-Winston Churchill
If you don't like us, don't accept our invitations and don't invite us to come to see you. Whether you like it or not, history is on our side. We will bury you.\n-Nikita Khrushchev
Berlin is the testicle of the West. When I want the West to scream, I squeeze on Berlin.\n-Nikita Khrushchev

As you talk to us from the Sea of Tranquility, it inspires us to redouble our efforts to bring peace and tranquility to Earth. For one priceless moment, in the whole history of man, all the people on this Earth are truly one.\n-Richard M. Nixon
Under Lenin the Soviet Union was like a religious revival, under Stalin like a prison, under Khrushchev like a circus, and under Brezhnev like the U.S. Post Office.\n-Jimmy Carter
Mr Gorbachev, tear down this wall!\n-Ronald Reagan
If the President knows what he wants, no bureaucrat can stop him. A President has to know when to stop taking advice.\n-Harry S. Truman

We must all turn our backs upon the horrors of the past. We must look to the future. We cannot afford to drag forward cross the years that are to come the hatreds and revenges which have sprung from the injuries of the past.\n-Winston Churchill

No one pretends that democracy is perfect or all-wise. Indeed, it has been said that democracy is the worst form of government except all those other forms that have been tried from time to time.\n-Winston Churchill
The reason for having diplomatic relations is not to confer a compliment, but to secure a convenience.\n-Winston Churchill
Of course, when you are winning a war almost everything that happens can be claimed to be right and wise.\n-Winston Churchill
He who rejects change is the architect of decay. The only human institution which rejects progress is the cemetery.\n-Harold Wilson
I get a little nauseated, perhaps, when I hear the phrase 'freedom of the press' used as freely as it is, knowing that a large part of our proprietorial press is not free at all.\n-Harold Wilson
How can you govern a country which has two hundred and forty-six varieties of cheese?\n-Charles de Gaulle
Politics, when it is an art and a service, not an exploitation, is about acting for an ideal through realities.\n-Charles de Gaulle
The revolution is not an apple that falls when it is ripe. You have to make it fall.\n-Ernesto Guevara
I am not a liberator. Liberators do not exist. The people liberate themselves.\n-Ernesto Guevara

The feeling of revolt will grow stronger every day among the peoples subjected to various degrees of exploitation, and they will take up arms to gain by force the rights which reason alone has not won them.\n-Ernesto Guevara

There are no borders in this struggle to the death. We cannot be indifferent to what happens anywhere in the world, because a victory by any country over imperialism is our victory, just as any country's defeat is a defeat for all of us.\n-Ernesto Guevara
I know you've come to kill me. Shoot coward, you are only going to kill a man.\n-Ernesto Guevara
